Class HumanPlayer

  • java.lang.Object
    • Player
      • HumanPlayer

  • public class HumanPlayer
extends Player
    Class used to handle a Player object in the event that it's a human
    Author:
    Kyle Dorcey

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private Board currentPlayingBoard
      Board object which contains a reference to the state of the current playing board
      private int playerNumber
      Integer which represents whether the player is player1 or player2
      private java.util.Scanner reader
      Scanner object used to read in console inputs for moves

    • Constructor Detail

      • HumanPlayer

        public HumanPlayer(int playerNumber,
                   Board currentPlayingBoard)
        Class constructor. Sets the playerNumber and CurrentPlayingBoard variables
        Parameters:
        playerNumber - Integer which represents whether the player is player1 or player2
        currentPlayingBoard - Board object which contains a reference to the state of the current playing board

    • Method Detail

      • makeMove

        public void makeMove()
        Method used to allow the human player to make a move. The method prompts the user for a x-coordinate and y-coordinate which corresponds with spaces on the tic-tac-toe board. (top left is (1,1), middle is (2,2), bottom right is (3,3), etc.) If the move is valid the turn is over, if it is not valid the user is asked for a different move
        Specified by:
        makeMove in class Player
